person.persName: Daniel Wolsey Voorhees (Representative and a Senator from Indiana)

body.p: Representative and a Senator from Indiana. Liberty Township, Ohio, native. Graduated from Indiana Asbury University in Greencastle, Indiana, in 1849. Married to Anna Hardesty Voorhees. Children included Mary Voorhees, Harriet Cecelia Voorhees, James P Voorhees, and Reese H Voorhees. Admitted to the bar in 1851 in Covington, Indiana. Moved to Terre Haute and continued the practice of law. Unsuccessful candidate for election in 1856 to the Thirty-fifth Congress. United States district attorney for Indiana 1858-1861. Elected as a Democrat to the Thirty-seventh and Thirty-eighth Congresses and served from March 4, 1861 to March 3, 1865. Presented credentials as a Member-elect to the Thirty-ninth Congress and served from March 4, 1865, to February 23, 1866, when he was succeeded by Henry D. Washburn, who contested the election.
